This is the full length movie indeed. The full length version is 104min long.

However the news gets even better for those who live in the US, and want a legit (non bootleg) copy. While the the DVD was always censored (99min for NC-17, and 102min for unrated), the US release on Bluray won't be. This month, on October 25, a Bluray version of it FULLY UNCUT will be released IN THE US. It is advertised on Amazon.com as lasting the full 104min! Yes this is the 100% UNCUT version! Preorder it at:
http://www.amazon.com/Serbian-Film-Blu-ray-Srdjan-Todorovic/dp/B005ER6STG/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1318837203&sr=8-1

You can ignore the customer reviews on the Amazon.com page complaining about it lasting less than 104 minutes and being cut. This Bluray version hasn't even been released yet as it comes out on the 25th of October, and now it's only the 17th of October. Those reviews are based on the DVD version which is indeed censored.

Indeed this is not for sensible people. I think the director was well aware of the impact the film will have and that it would be censored or banned in some places and that his ambitions with this would not come across. I say ambitions loosely because I believe this film will only come across as exploitative and the presentation of the subject that it wants to criticise too stark for the audience.
